# The `AMDGPUAlwaysInlinePass.cpp` File Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This pass marks all internal functions as always&#95;inline and creates duplicates of all other functions and marks the duplicates as always&#95;inline. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

This pass marks all internal functions as always&#95;inline and creates duplicates of all other functions and marks the duplicates as always&#95;inline.

<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>-&gt;eraseFromParent();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Always force inlining of any function that uses an LDS global address. This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is something of a workaround because we don&#39;t have a way of supporting LDS</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// objects defined in functions. LDS is always allocated by a kernel, and it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is difficult to manage LDS usage if a function may be used by multiple</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// kernels.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// OpenCL doesn&#39;t allow declaring LDS in non-kernels, so in practice this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// should only appear when IPO passes manages to move LDs defined in a kernel</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// into a single user function.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvariable">GlobalVariable</a> &amp;GV : M.globals()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// TODO: Region address</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> AS = GV.getAddressSpace();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ((AS == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/amdgpuas/#a899ad5bfccfc22965a6714929a3dfae1a5b71ba6fa435ec288aba849e113721a7">AMDGPUAS::REGION&#95;ADDRESS</a>) ||</span></CodeLine>
